Package cip.render.raytrace.material

These are classes supporting material models that produce the surface appearance of geometries.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Blinn
    This is an implementation of the Blinn illumination model as described in Blinn, James F (1977), "Models of Light Reflection for Computer Synthesized Images", ACM Computer Graphics, (SIGGRAPH 77), vol 11, no 2, pp.92-198.
    Hall
    This is an implementation of the Hall illumination model as described in Hall, Roy A and D P Greenberg (1983), "A Testbed for Realistic Image Synthesis", IEEE Computer Graphics and Applications, Nov 1983; and later in Hall, R A, Color and Illumination in Computer Generated Imagery, Springer-Verlag, New York 1988.
    PackageConstants
    These are constants that control reflection and transmission recursion depth so ray-tracing does not get into infinitely recursive loops.
    Whitted
    An implementation of the Whitted illumination model as described in Whitted, Turner (1980), "An Improved Illumination Model for Shaded Display", Communications of the ACM, vol 23, no 6, pp 343-349.

Package cip.render.raytrace.material Description

These are classes supporting material models that produce the surface appearance of geometries. This package supports the primary reflection and illumination models proposed in the 70's, 80's and 90's along with texture function, and various slope distribution and geometric attenuation functions.
